Divisibility
Let . We say that divides or if for some , . In this case, is a divisor of . If there is no such such that then does not divide or .


Prime
An Integer is prime if the only positive divisors of are and . If is not prime then is composite.


Fundamental Theorem of Arithmetic:
Every integer greater than 1 can be represented in exactly one way apart from rearrangement as a product of one or more primes.


Greatest Common Divisor
Let . Let

$$ \begin{align*} gcd(a,b) = \max \{ d \in Z : d \ |\ a \ \text{ and } \ d \ | \ b \} \end{align*} $$

is the greatest common divisor of both and .


Properties of the Greatest Common Divisor
Let , we have

$$ \begin{align*} gcd(a,b) = gcd(a,b-a) = gcd(a,b+a) \end{align*} $$
